business.headline: When missed EMIs become a nightmare: Inside India's loan harassment trapBehind India's digital lending rise is a quieter story of calls, pressure and fear. Data suggests that loan recovery harassment is growing at a pace the system can no longer keep up with.
Sensex ends 500 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; HCLTech gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 513.45 points to close at 85,186.47, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 142.60 points to end at 26,052.65.

Big fat Indian weddings can now be insured. Should you get one?India is gearing up for one of its busiest wedding seasons ever. In 2025 alone, nearly 46 lakh weddings are expected, generating close to Rs 6.5 lakh crore in spending.

He lost Rs 40,000: Expert explains how online gaming apps trap usersExpert says insiders from gaming firms have revealed how these apps operate. They label heavy spenders as "whales" and have teams calling them daily to push more deposits.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPExcelsoft Technologies aims to raise Rs 500 crore through the IPO, which includes a fresh issue of 1.50 crore shares worth Rs 180 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.67 crore shares worth Rs 320 crore.

Wrong member ID linked to your UAN? Here's how EPFO lets you fix itMany employees discover that their UAN has been linked to a wrong member ID, often due to job changes or data errors. EPFO has introduced an easy online method to fix this, without visiting any office.

How every day micro-payments eat into your savingsWelcome to India's new spending reality, the age of micro-payments that silently seep into your accounts and cause invisible leaks. By the end of the month, many people find their digital wallets, likePaytm, PhonePe, Google Pay, have quietly leaked hundreds and thousands of rupees.

NCR office rents are rising: What's driving commercial real estate prices up?Expressway expansions, metro lines, and upcoming airports are easing mobility while opening new economic opportunities in the NCR.

Groww shares crash 10% to hit lower circuit. Why are investors booking profits?The share price of Groww fell 10% in early trade and slipped straight to the lower circuit, a sharp contrast to the over 90% rally investors had witnessed over the past few days.

Government to release new ITR forms by January 2026. How will they impact taxpayers?What will the new ITR forms, expected by January 2026, mean for ordinary taxpayers as India shifts to the updated Income Tax Act, 2025? Have a look here.
Tenneco Clean Air Share Price: Stock makes strong debut at 27% premiumTenneco Clean Air shares listed at Rs 505 on the NSE and Rs 498 on the BSE, compared with its issue price of Rs 397.

Groww shares slump 10% after massive post-listing rally. Why is it falling today?After four straight sessions of runaway gains, the stock finally cooled off on Wednesday, down sharply in early trade. At around 9:50 am, shares of the company were down 10% to Rs 169.89 on the NSE.
Waaree Energies share price falls over 5%. Why is it down today?The stock slipped 4.26% to Rs 3,143.20 on the BSE in the opening minutes and later extended losses to trade 5.6% lower at Rs 3,089.
Sensex, Nifty trade flat; analysts urge investors to stay defensiveThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 81.17 points to 84,591.85 at 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 32.40 points to 25,877.65.

Gold, silver prices drop: Will the fall continue? What investors should knowGold, silver price: The focus now is on the minutes from the Fed's latest policy meeting and key US jobs data, both of which may influence gold and silver prices in the coming days.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO listing: Strong debut or slow start? What GMP suggestsTenneco Clean Air offered 6,34,76,070 shares, but investors placed bids for 3,92,21,37,714 shares, amounting to Rs 1,55,708.87 crore, showing strong interest in the company.

Credit card EMIs: Smart tool or hidden cost?Credit card EMIs have become a common way to manage big purchases, but are they truly a smart budgeting tool or just another expense disguised as convenience?

Good news on India–US trade deal once it's fair and equitable, says Piyush GoyalSpeaking at the Indo-US Economic Summit organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce in New Delhi, Piyush Goyal said negotiations are moving ahead, but a final announcement will come only when the terms are acceptable and mutually beneficial.

What is the 9-9-6 work culture Narayana Murthy wants Indians to learn from?In his latest remarks, Murthy referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 working culture, a system followed by many Chinese tech companies during their rapid growth phase.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we unpack what the number really means for policyholders.

entertainment.headline: Veer Pahariya calls Tara Sutaria his whole heart in romantic birthday post Tara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya's growing romance takes centre stage as the couple shares affectionate moments online and at public events. Now, the latter shared a hearty birthday wish for her on social media.

Anurag Kashyap reviews 'Manjummel Boys': 'Hindi cinema really is far left behind' Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap reviewed the Malayalam film 'Manjummel Boys'. He called the survival thriller 'simply an extraordinary piece of confident mainstream filmmaking'.

Dhurandhar row: Ranvir Shorey slams Dhruv Rathee after U-turn on Wasseypur praise Dhruv Rathee criticised the violent content of the 'Dhurandhar' trailer, sparking a heated online debate. A heated debate erupted on social media between him and actor Ranvir Shorey over the violent content in the trailer.

Exclusive: Inside Dining With the Kapoors with Armaan Jain, where legacy meets food In an exclusive interview with India Today, 'Dining With The Kapoors' creators Armaan Jain and Smriti Mundhra spoke about celebrating the Kapoor legacy and Raj Kapoor.

Nabha Natesh goes bungee jumping, Swayambhu co-star Nikhil Siddhartha reacts Actor Nabha Natesh showed her adventurous side by bungee jumping in New Zealand, as co-actor Nikhil Siddharth reacted with surprise

Haq director backs Dhurandhar, says foreign films with same violence are praised Director Suparn S Varma came out in support of Aditya Dhar after the 'Dhurandhar' trailer drew backlash for its violent scenes. He criticised the double standards in how Indian films are judged compared to international cinema.

Zayn says Jisoo collab happened naturally: My daughter's gonna think I'm cool British singer Zayn Malik reflects on his collaborative single with BLACKPINK's Jisoo, detailing how the partnership emerged and the impact his daughter's admiration for the K-pop star had on his decision to participate.

Actor Yash's mother alleges Rs 65 lakh fraud by film promoter, files complaint Pushpalatha, mother of actor Yash, has filed a complaint with Bengaluru police accusing film promoter Harish Arasu of cheating her out of Rs 64,87,700 during the promotion of her debut film 'Kothalavadi'.

Priyanka Chopra confirms Telugu dubbing for Rajamouli's Varanasi Priyanka Chopra Jonas is set to make her return to Indian cinema after almost six years, taking on a lead role in SS Rajamouli's new film 'Varanasi'. She will voice her own character in the sci-fi project, confirming her involvement in both acting and Telugu dubbing.

Enrique Iglesias shares he's expecting baby No. 4: So excited Tennis star Anna Kournikova and singer Enrique Iglesias are expecting their fourth child, with the couple reportedly "so excited" as they prepare to become a family of six.

Exclusive: How Vaibhav Thakkar found the Gomu Gomu spark for Hindi Luffy In an exclusive interview, voice artist Vaibhav Thakkar shares how he brings Monkey D Luffy to life in Hindi, from vocal preparation to fan love, and his journey into voice acting for 'One Piece'.

Still gives me chills: Aditya Jambhale on eerie story linking Baramulla, Article 370 Filmmaker Aditya Suhas Jambhale opened up about a chilling coincidence that connects his films 'Baramulla' and 'Article 370'. The Netflix film was shot at a real-life location in Kashmir.

Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran hints at Memories sequel, confirms busy slate Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran has shared insights on the highly anticipated sequel to the film 'Memories' as well as his current and upcoming projects. He also revealed the status of several ongoing productions, and spoke about collaborations with prominent directors and technicians.

Animal, Kill, Marco, Dhurandhar: Time for R-rating from censors for Indian films? A new wave of blood-soaked hits is redefining mainstream cinema. With gory films like 'Kill', 'Animal', and 'Marco' becoming crowd-pullers, and the trailer of 'Dhurandhar' promising unprecedented violence, is it time to reorganise the censor norms?

Vishal Dadlani reveals Amitabh Bachchan inspired the music for SRK's Pathaan Music composer duo Vishal-Shekhar are set to appear as special guests on 'KBC 17'. In the latest promo, they are seen performing the 'Pathaan' title track.

Aishwarya Rai touches PM Modi's feet at event, speaks on love and religion. Video Aishwarya Rai Bachchan attended the birth centenary celebrations of Sri Sathya Sai Baba in Puttaparthi, where she touched Prime Minister Narendra Modi's feet before delivering a speech on caste, religion and love.

Biggest part of our heart: Arbaaz-Sshura share first photos of baby Sipaara Arbaaz Khan and Sshura shared the first photos of their daughter, Sipaara Khan, on Wednesday. The couple welcomed their baby girl on October 5.

Jaideep Ahlawat says his village celebrated childbirth by watching Big B's classics Jaideep Ahlawat and Manoj Bajpayee shared emotional memories of Amitabh Bachchan on the 'KBC' stage, from village traditions built around Big B's films to unforgettable first meetings with the superstar. Their heartfelt stories left Bachchan and the audience deeply moved, creating a nostalgic, full-circle episode.

The Running Man Exclusive: Director Edgar on Glen Powell, Lee Pace on playing a masked hunter In an exclusive chat with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, director Edgar Wright and actor Lee Pace spoke about The Running Man, working with Glen Powell, India and why Lee decided to play a masked role. Don't miss this candid chat!

general news.headline: Live: Nitish Kumar elected leader of NDA, set to be 10-time Bihar Chief MinisterBihar New Government Formation Live: Following the NDA's sweeping victory in the Bihar Assembly polls, Nitish Kumar is poised to take the reins of the state for a record 10th time. A day before he is sworn in as Chief Minister again, the JD(U) supremo will be elected as the NDA's leader today, after which he will tender his resignation to Governor Arif Mohammad Khan as the head of the outgoing government. The oath-taking ceremony will take place on Thursday at the Gandhi Maidan in Patna. PM Narendra Modi, Union Ministers, Chief Ministers of BJP-ruled states and other top officials will be in attendance. Stay tuned with IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest developments from Bihar.

We hit India from Red Fort to Kashmir's forests: Pak leader's big admissionIn a stunning admission of Pakistan's role in fuelling cross-border terrorism, Pakistani leader Chaudhry Anwarul Haq openly acknowledged that terror outfits struck India "from the Red Fort to the forests of Kashmir".

Nobody killed Nithari children? Moninder Pandher bares all on 19-year mysteryNithari killings: Both the accused in the sensational Nithari serial killings, Surender Koli and Moninder Singh Pandher, have now been acquitted. It leaves a simple, unanswered question: Who killed the children? Pandher divulges all in a tell-all interview.

Tejashwi, Rahul missing, PK emerges as tallest Bihar Opposition leaderWith Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav missing after the poll debacle in Bihar, Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor has stepped into the spotlight, vowing to hold the NDA accountable on its poll promises. PK is starting his role of an opposition leader with a fast at Champaran's Gandhi Ashram, coinciding with Nitish Kumar's oath ceremony at Patna's Gandhi Maidan on November 20.

Aishwarya Rai touches PM Modi's feet at event, speaks on love and religion. VideoAishwarya Rai Bachchan attended the birth centenary celebrations of Sri Sathya Sai Baba in Puttaparthi, where she touched Prime Minister Narendra Modi's feet before delivering a speech on caste, religion and love.

Live: NIA arrests Lawrence Bishnoi's brother Anmol after he's deported from USAnmol Bishnoi Deportation Live: Gangster Anmol Bishnoi, wanted in multiple high-profile cases including the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddiqui, has been brought to India and handed over to NIA. He landed at Delhi airport under heavy security and is being taken directly to Patiala House Court. His return marks a major breakthrough for central agencies, with several state police forces now set to seek his custody.

Bangladesh to tap Interpol to get Sheikh Hasina extradited from IndiaMuhammad Yunus' interim administration is preparing to seek Interpol's assistance to get ousted PM Sheikh Hasina and former Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal extradited from India. This comes after the two were handed death sentences by the International Crimes Tribunal.

Selective outrage: Judges, bureaucrats slam Rahul Gandhi's vote chori chargeAn open letter, written by 272 eminent personalities, called out the Congress's criticism towards the Election Commission and urged an end to conspiracy-laced rhetoric against institutions.

Freeze eggs, focus on career: Upasana Konidela faces backlash after advice at IITUpasana Konidela, a top executive of Apollo Hospitals, faced massive backlash after suggesting students at IIT Hyderabad to prioritise careers by freezing eggs. Doctors called out Konidela's claim that egg freezing was an "insurance". Upasana Konidela married actor Ram Charan when she was 23 and had a child at 34.
Isro captures interstellar comet from telescope at Mount Abu. See picIsro captures interstellar comet 3I/Atlas from telescope at Mount Abu. See pic here

Varanasi: Title dispute erupts over Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu-Priyanka Chopra filmA dispute over the title rights of the upcoming film 'Varanasi' has emerged after it was learnt that it lies with CH Subba Reddy of Rama Bramha Hanuma Creations. The Rajamouli-directorial features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

When missed EMIs become a nightmare: Inside India's loan harassment trapBehind India's digital lending rise is a quieter story of calls, pressure and fear. Data suggests that loan recovery harassment is growing at a pace the system can no longer keep up with.

Anmol Bishnoi, wanted in NCP leader and Moose Wala murders, brought to India  Live UpdatesAnmol Bishnoi, the brother of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi and the main accused in the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique, was deported from the US.

Tiger zinda hai: Big cat returns to Gujarat forest after 32 yearsForest officials have confirmed that a male tiger has been living in the Ratan Mahal Wildlife Sanctuary in Dahod district for the past nine months.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Sundar Pichai warns AI bubble burst could shake all tech firms, including GoogleAs AI fever grips global markets, Google CEO Sundar Pichai warns that when the hype cools, even the biggest tech players may feel the chill.
Two Amur Falcons Fly 5,000 km Non-Stop from India to SomaliaThe birds were tagged by scientists as part of a project and are being tracked while they migrate across continents.

Video: Masked men with sticks, swords storm Bhopal cafe; couple flees mid-mealOver 20 masked miscreants at Bhopal's Magic Spot Café stormed in and vandalised the premises with swords and sticks. CCTV footage shows the attackers breaking counters, glass panels, furniture, displays, and machines, while also assaulting café employees, one of whom was struck by a sword, leaving a customer injured as well.

Bihar shockwave disrupts Congress' Karnataka power swap As the November 21 deadline for the supposed transfer of power stares, both 'the Siddu and DKS camps' got ready to reach New Delhi on Nov 15 with their respective strategies.

Putting children in gas chambers: Supreme Court on sports activities amid pollutionThe Supreme Court observed that allowing sports activities during November and December, when the pollution levels are at their peak, "amounts to putting school children in a gas chamber."

Dragged us, ripped our chaddors: Imran Khan's sisters manhandled near Pak jailThe incident happened when the former Pakistan PM's sisters, denied a weekly meeting with the jailed Imran Khan, staged a 10-hour sit-in outside the prison.

Zoho CEO's 'marry in your 20s' advice divides Internet on career vs familyZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu's advice that young entrepreneurs should marry and have kids in their 20s has sparked a debate on social media.

Barron's a big fan: Trump to Ronaldo as football star attends state dinner for MBSIn an address at the state dinner on Tuesday night, Donald Trump thanked the five-time Ballon d'Or winner for attending and said that his youngest son, Barron, is a "big fan" and the 19-year-old was impressed that he got to meet the Portugal football legend.

From DNA repair to Prakrit studies, meet the Infosys Prize 2025 winnersThe Infosys Prize 2025 celebrates six scholars who are changing the way the world thinks. Their path-breaking work spans economics, engineering, humanities, life sciences, mathematics and physical sciences, spotlighting new ideas shaping India's scientific and intellectual future.

Veer Pahariya calls Tara Sutaria his whole heart in romantic birthday postTara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya's growing romance takes centre stage as the couple shares affectionate moments online and at public events. Now, the latter shared a hearty birthday wish for her on social media.

Dhurandhar row: Ranvir Shorey slams Dhruv Rathee after U-turn on Wasseypur praiseDhruv Rathee criticised the violent content of the 'Dhurandhar' trailer, sparking a heated online debate. A heated debate erupted on social media between him and actor Ranvir Shorey over the violent content in the trailer.

sports.headline: Sleepless night for Mushfiqur Rahim in 100th Test as batter stuck on 99 vs Ireland BAN vs IRE: Mushfiqur Rahim capped his 100th Test with a gritty unbeaten 99, steering Bangladesh to 292 for four and setting up a highly anticipated push for a landmark century on Day 2 in Mirpur.

Shai Hope's 109 in vain as New Zealand win Napier thriller to claim ODI series New Zealand sealed a 2-0 series lead with a five-wicket win in the rain-shortened second ODI, chasing 248 with three balls to spare. Shai Hope's brilliant unbeaten 109, which equalled Brian Lara's West Indies record of 19 ODI hundreds, went in vain.

Pigeonholed as a T20I finisher? In-form Rinku Singh deserves a Test look-in Rinku Singh's dominant 175 against Tamil Nadu has reignited the debate around his long-format potential. With a stellar First-Class average of 57.39 and consistent domestic performances, the Uttar Pradesh batter is making a persuasive case for a long-overdue Test call-up.

England keep playing XI suspense alive, name 12-man squad for Perth series opener England have named a 12-man squad for the first Ashes Test against Australia in Perth. The visiting team has kept the spinner selection flexible while Mark Wood is fit after injury concerns.

Rohit Sharma loses No. 1 spot in ODI batting ranking weeks after Sydney century Former India captain Rohit Sharma has lost the No.1 spot in the latest ICC ODI batting rankings, with Daryl Mitchell becoming the first New Zealander since 1979 to rise to the top of the list.

Shubman Gill spotted with neck brace at Kolkata airport, travels to Guwahati India Test captain Shubman Gill was spotted at Kolkata airport wearing a neck brace as he travelled with the rest of the Indian team to Guwahati for the second Test against South Africa, starting on November 22.

Shai Hope equals Brian Lara with 19th ODI hundred in rescue act vs New Zealand West Indies captain Shai Hope struck his 19th ODI hundred, an unbeaten 109, to pull his team out of early trouble and lift them to 247 in the second ODI against New Zealand.

LeBron James hints at skipping 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles, Curry's return doubtful LeBron James and Stephen Curry opened up on a podcast, revealing doubts about their Olympic futures as Team USA approaches a generational shift ahead of the 2028 Los Angeles Games, raising questions about a new era without its biggest icons.

Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, not ruled out of 2nd Test vs South Africa India vs South Africa: The BCCI on Wednesday confirmed that Shubman Gill would travel with the rest of the team to Guwahati. The board added that the captain has responded well to treatment after being hospitalised for a neck injury sustained in Kolkata.

McGrath dropped! Australia great out of commentary duty over betting deal Australian cricket legend Glenn McGrath has withdrawn from ABC's Ashes coverage following the broadcaster's policy on betting affiliations, prompting a reshuffle in the commentary lineup ahead of the first Test in Perth.

I don't care: Zimbabwe captain stuns Pak journalist with blunt reply before tri-series Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza declined to rank Asian T20I teams when answering a question from a reporter in Rawalpindi. The all-rounder handled an unrelated question with unrelated question with both grace and firmness.

The board added that the captain has responded well to treatment after being hospitalised for a neck injury sustained in Kolkata.

McGrath dropped! Australia great out of commentary duty over betting deal Australian cricket legend Glenn McGrath has withdrawn from ABC's Ashes coverage following the broadcaster's policy on betting affiliations, prompting a reshuffle in the commentary lineup ahead of the first Test in Perth.

I don't care: Zimbabwe captain stuns Pak journalist with blunt reply before tri-series Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza declined to rank Asian T20I teams when answering a question from a reporter in Rawalpindi. The all-rounder handled an unrelated question with unrelated question with both grace and firmness.

BCCI curators took over: Sourav Ganguly distances himself from Eden pitch sagaThere has been plenty of talk surrounding the Eden Gardens pitch, and Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) president Sourav Ganguly has now clarified that BCCI-appointed curators were in charge of the surface for the upcoming Test match.

Shane Warne's magic lives on: England fans to make emotional tribute on Boxing DayEngland's Barmy Army is preparing a fitting tribute to honour the late Shane Warne during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG, marking the first Ashes clash at the venue since his passing and uniting fans beyond traditional rivalry.

Lightning halts Australia's training session ahead of 1st Test in PerthAustralia's training session ahead of the Ashes at Perth Stadium was abruptly halted after lightning was detected in the vicinity, despite clear skies. Players and staff were immediately instructed to leave the field in accordance with safety regulations.

Bazball was designed only for Ashes in Australia: Ponting's stunning claimFormer Australia captain Ricky Ponting has claimed that England's Bazball approach was crafted with a single objective: to win the Ashes in Australia. He also accused the team of being dishonest in the way they publicly speak about their aggressive style and the results it has produced.

Curacao becomes the smallest-ever nation to qualify for FIFA World CupCuracao have become the smallest country ever to qualify for a FIFA World Cup finals after holding on for a tense 0-0 draw against Jamaica on the final day of the Concacaf qualifying campaign.

The horror of 19 November: A first-hand account of how a billion dreams shatteredThe morning of 19 November 2023 dawned with a sense of hope that seemed to bind the entire nation together. Billions prayed for their collective World Cup dream to finally come true. It was unlike any other day — all roads led to the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, where a sea of Indian fans gathered, hearts pounding, ready to witness history unfold. But as the hours wore on, it became clear that destiny had scripted a different ending.

Curacao becomes the smallest-ever nation to qualify for FIFA World CupCuracao have become the smallest country ever to qualify for a FIFA World Cup finals after holding on for a tense 0-0 draw against Jamaica on the final day of the Concacaf qualifying campaign.

The horror of 19 November: A first-hand account of how a billion dreams shatteredThe morning of 19 November 2023 dawned with a sense of hope that seemed to bind the entire nation together. Billions prayed for their collective World Cup dream to finally come true. It was unlike any other day — all roads led to the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, where a sea of Indian fans gathered, hearts pounding, ready to witness history unfold. But as the hours wore on, it became clear that destiny had scripted a different ending.

Scotland beat Denmark 4-2 in thriller to reach first men's World Cup in 28 yearsScotland qualified for the men's World Cup for the first time in nearly three decades after two stoppage-time goals sealed a thrilling 4-2 victory over Denmark at Hampden Park.

Barron's a big fan: Trump to Ronaldo as football star attends state dinner for MBSIn an address at the state dinner on Tuesday night, Donald Trump thanked the five-time Ballon d'Or winner for attending and said that his youngest son, Barron, is a "big fan" and the 19-year-old was impressed that he got to meet the Portugal football legend.

Will desperate India bring reinforcements to counter Simon Harmer threat?India face a selection dilemma for the Guwahati Test as Shubman Gill's absence forces a rethink of their left-hand heavy batting order, pushing the team to consider in-form options like Karun Nair or Ruturaj Gaikwad to counter South Africa's spin threat.

Gambhir wasn't playing Kolkata Test: Robin Uthappa slams India coach criticsIndia's dramatic collapse to just 93 at Eden Gardens has reignited criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir, but former India batter Robin Uthappa believes the blame is misplaced. Uthappa insists that a coach cannot be held responsible when players fail to execute their plans on the field.

Washington Sundar not a No.3 batter, India need to rethink his spot: Sourav GangulyIND vs SA: Sourav Ganguly questioned Washington Sundar's suitability as India's No. 3 in Tests and criticised the team's decision to play four spinners in the Kolkata match, urging a return to specialist top-order batters and a more balanced attack.

India A cruise to Asia Cup semis despite rare off day for Vaibhav SuryavanshiIndia A bounced back strongly after their loss to Pakistan A, easing past Oman A to reach the Asia Cup semifinals. Harsh Dubey's composed fifty and a disciplined bowling effort ensured a confident, much-needed turnaround for the squad.

India's football dream screams after embarrassing 0-1 loss to BangladeshIndia's 0–1 defeat to Bangladesh capped a tough night that summed up a wider footballing crisis. With the ISL's future uncertain and the national team bottom of their group, India's football dream feels increasingly shaky.

No question of sacking Gautam Gambhir, India need better pitches: Sourav GangulyFormer Indian skipper Sourav Ganguly has dismissed calls to sack Gautam Gambhir after India's Eden Gardens defeat. Instead, he believes pitches, patience and clearer planning are the real priorities as India look to correct recurring Test-match flaws.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
